column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0232] A conduit 240 is positioned within the borehole 210.

#Text=The conduit 240 comprises along the portion of its length that is surrounded by the unlined portion 215 of borehole 210, apertures 245 configured for spraying a solvent, preferably in a lateral and down-dip direction.
#Text=The apertures 245 are sized in such a manner to evenly distribute the solvent along the length of conduit 240 which is inserted in the borehole portion 215.

#Text=[0233] Solvent is then pumped down the conduit 240 at the desired flow and pressure in such a manner that the solvent exiting the apertures is sprayed onto the ore within the unlined borehole portion 215 in a desired pattern.

#Text=The solvent spray dissolves away desired solute (trona) from this exposed ore region around the apertures, in a manner effective to form a liquor comprising dissolved solute, which then flows towards borehole end 220, passes through the drillhole portion 238 and collects into the sump, where it may be pumped to the surface via the pumping system 230.
#Text=[0234] The dissolution is also effective in forming the undercut 260 at the footwall of the borehole portion 215 at the floor of the ore bed 205.

#Text=Due to the formation of this voided undercut and the pressure from the overburden, fracture of unexposed ore located above this undercut occurs and the ore ruble so created moves downward by gravity into the undercut 260.
#Text=The solute in the ore rubble fallen into the undercut is exposed to the solvent and dissolves away.
#Text=This solution mining process continues as the undercut 260 travels down-dip as dissolution progresses, and until the voided area reaches the ore roof.

#Text=[0235] FIG. 10 is a plan view of a system 3b which comprises a trona bed 305, a borehole 210 with one unlined portions 315 with a downhole end 320, a solvent 325, a return drillhole 335 with an unlined portion 338, a pump 330, and an undercut 360.
#Text=Contrary to FIG. 9, the system 3b does not comprise a conduit for delivering a solvent to the ore bed.
#Text=[0236] The borehole 310 is drilled vertically to penetrate the trona bed 305 at a desired location 312.
#Text=The desired location is preferably within an up-dip region of the trona bed 305, such as for example a trona region proximate to the up-dip lateral edge of the trona bed 305.
#Text=The desired location 312 is within the bed, but slightly above the bed floor.
#Text=The borehole 310 is cased or suitably lined from the surface to down the top of the trona bed 205.
#Text=The borehole 310 is further extended with the horizontal unlined portion 315 directionally drilled within the trona bed above the bed floor.
#Text=Unlined portion 315 of borehole 310 is preferably horizontal, but may also have a grade with its downhole end 320 preferably being down-grade.
